4/* NAME

13 /*
14 * System library.
15 */
16#include <unistd.h>

18 /*
19 * Utility library.
20 */
21#include <htable.h>
22#include <argv.h>
23#include <dict.h>
24#include <name_code.h>

26 /*
27 * What we're supposed to be doing.
28 */
29#define PCF_SHOW_NONDEF (1<<0) /* show main.cf non-default settings */
30#define PCF_SHOW_DEFS (1<<1) /* show main.cf default setting */
31#define PCF_HIDE_NAME (1<<2) /* hide main.cf parameter name */
32#define PCF_SHOW_MAPS (1<<3) /* show map types */
33#define PCF_EDIT_CONF (1<<4) /* edit main.cf or master.cf */
34#define PCF_SHOW_LOCKS (1<<5) /* show mailbox lock methods */
35#define PCF_SHOW_EVAL (1<<6) /* expand main.cf right-hand sides */
36#define PCF_SHOW_SASL_SERV (1<<7) /* show server auth plugin types */
37#define PCF_SHOW_SASL_CLNT (1<<8) /* show client auth plugin types */
38#define PCF_COMMENT_OUT (1<<9) /* #-out selected main.cf entries */
39#define PCF_MASTER_ENTRY (1<<10) /* manage master.cf entries */
40#define PCF_FOLD_LINE (1<<11) /* fold long *.cf entries */
41#define PCF_EDIT_EXCL (1<<12) /* exclude main.cf entries */
42#define PCF_MASTER_FLD (1<<13) /* hierarchical pathname */
43#define PCF_MAIN_PARAM (1<<14) /* manage main.cf entries */
44#define PCF_EXP_DSN_TEMPL (1<<15) /* expand bounce templates */
45#define PCF_PARAM_CLASS (1<<16) /* select parameter class */
46#define PCF_MAIN_OVER (1<<17) /* override parameter values */
47#define PCF_DUMP_DSN_TEMPL (1<<18) /* show bounce templates */
48#define PCF_MASTER_PARAM (1<<19) /* manage master.cf -o name=value */
49#define PCF_HIDE_VALUE (1<<20) /* hide main.cf/master.cf =value */
50#define PCF_SHOW_TLS (1<<21) /* TLS support introspection */
51
52#define PCF_DEF_MODE 0
53
54 /*
55 * Structure for one "valid parameter" (built-in, service-defined or valid
56 * user-defined). See the postconf_builtin, postconf_service and
57 * postconf_user modules for narrative text.
58 */
59typedef struct {
60 int flags; /* see below */
61 void *param_data; /* mostly, the default value */
62 const char *(*convert_fn) (void *); /* value to string */
63} PCF_PARAM_NODE;
64
65 /* Values for flags. See the postconf_node module for narrative text. */
66#define PCF_PARAM_FLAG_RAW (1<<0) /* raw parameter value */
67#define PCF_PARAM_FLAG_BUILTIN (1<<1) /* built-in parameter name */
68#define PCF_PARAM_FLAG_SERVICE (1<<2) /* service-defined parameter name */
69#define PCF_PARAM_FLAG_USER (1<<3) /* user-defined parameter name */
70#define PCF_PARAM_FLAG_LEGACY (1<<4) /* legacy parameter name */
71#define PCF_PARAM_FLAG_READONLY (1<<5) /* legacy parameter name */
72#define PCF_PARAM_FLAG_DBMS (1<<6) /* dbms-defined parameter name */
73
74#define PCF_PARAM_MASK_CLASS \
75 (PCF_PARAM_FLAG_BUILTIN | PCF_PARAM_FLAG_SERVICE | PCF_PARAM_FLAG_USER)
76#define PCF_PARAM_CLASS_OVERRIDE(node, class) \
77 ((node)->flags = (((node)->flags & ~PCF_PARAM_MASK_CLASS) | (class)))
78
79#define PCF_RAW_PARAMETER(node) ((node)->flags & PCF_PARAM_FLAG_RAW)
80#define PCF_LEGACY_PARAMETER(node) ((node)->flags & PCF_PARAM_FLAG_LEGACY)
81#define PCF_READONLY_PARAMETER(node) ((node)->flags & PCF_PARAM_FLAG_READONLY)
82#define PCF_DBMS_PARAMETER(node) ((node)->flags & PCF_PARAM_FLAG_DBMS)
83
84 /* Values for param_data. See postconf_node module for narrative text. */
85#define PCF_PARAM_NO_DATA ((char *) 0)
86
87 /*
88 * Lookup table for global "valid parameter" information.
89 */
90#define PCF_PARAM_TABLE HTABLE
91#define PCF_PARAM_INFO HTABLE_INFO
92
93extern PCF_PARAM_TABLE *pcf_param_table;
94
95 /*
96 * postconf_node.c.
97 */
98#define PCF_PARAM_TABLE_CREATE(size) htable_create(size);
99#define PCF_PARAM_NODE_CAST(ptr) ((PCF_PARAM_NODE *) (ptr))
100
101#define PCF_PARAM_TABLE_LIST(table) htable_list(table)
102#define PCF_PARAM_INFO_NAME(ht) ((const char *) (ht)->key)
103#define PCF_PARAM_INFO_NODE(ht) PCF_PARAM_NODE_CAST((ht)->value)
104
105#define PCF_PARAM_TABLE_FIND(table, name) \
106 PCF_PARAM_NODE_CAST(htable_find((table), (name)))
107#define PCF_PARAM_TABLE_LOCATE(table, name) htable_locate((table), (name))
108#define PCF_PARAM_TABLE_ENTER(table, name, flags, data, func) \
109 htable_enter((table), (name), (char *) pcf_make_param_node((flags), \
110 (data), (func)))
111
112extern PCF_PARAM_NODE *pcf_make_param_node(int, void *, const char *(*) (void *));
113extern const char *pcf_convert_param_node(int, const char *, PCF_PARAM_NODE *);
114extern VSTRING *pcf_param_string_buf;
115
116 /*
117 * Structure of one master.cf entry.
118 */
119typedef struct {
120 char *name_space; /* service/type, parameter name space */
121 ARGV *argv; /* null, or master.cf fields */
122 DICT *all_params; /* null, or all name=value entries */
123 HTABLE *valid_names; /* null, or "valid" parameter names */
124} PCF_MASTER_ENT;
125
126#define PCF_MASTER_MIN_FIELDS 8 /* mandatory field minimum */
127
128#define PCF_MASTER_NAME_SERVICE "service"
129#define PCF_MASTER_NAME_TYPE "type"
130#define PCF_MASTER_NAME_PRIVATE "private"
131#define PCF_MASTER_NAME_UNPRIV "unprivileged"
132#define PCF_MASTER_NAME_CHROOT "chroot"
133#define PCF_MASTER_NAME_WAKEUP "wakeup"
134#define PCF_MASTER_NAME_MAXPROC "process_limit"
135#define PCF_MASTER_NAME_CMD "command"
136
137#define PCF_MASTER_FLD_SERVICE 0 /* service name */
138#define PCF_MASTER_FLD_TYPE 1 /* service type */
139#define PCF_MASTER_FLD_PRIVATE 2 /* private service */
140#define PCF_MASTER_FLD_UNPRIV 3 /* unprivileged service */
141#define PCF_MASTER_FLD_CHROOT 4 /* chrooted service */
142#define PCF_MASTER_FLD_WAKEUP 5 /* wakeup timer */
143#define PCF_MASTER_FLD_MAXPROC 6 /* process limit */
144#define PCF_MASTER_FLD_CMD 7 /* command */
145
146#define PCF_MASTER_FLD_WILDC -1 /* wild-card */
147#define PCF_MASTER_FLD_NONE -2 /* not available */
148
149 /*
150 * Lookup table for master.cf entries. The table is terminated with an entry
151 * that has a null argv member.
152 */
153PCF_MASTER_ENT *pcf_master_table;
154
155 /*
156 * Line-wrapping support.
157 */
158#define PCF_LINE_LIMIT 80 /* try to fold longer lines */
159#define PCF_SEPARATORS " \t\r\n"
160#define PCF_INDENT_LEN 4 /* indent long text by 4 */
161#define PCF_INDENT_TEXT " "

190extern void pcf_read_master(int);
191extern void pcf_show_master_entries(VSTREAM *, int, int, char **);
192extern const char *pcf_parse_master_entry(PCF_MASTER_ENT *, const char *);
193extern void pcf_print_master_entry(VSTREAM *, int, PCF_MASTER_ENT *);
194extern void pcf_free_master_entry(PCF_MASTER_ENT *);
195extern void pcf_show_master_fields(VSTREAM *, int, int, char **);
196extern void pcf_edit_master_field(PCF_MASTER_ENT *, int, const char *);
197extern void pcf_show_master_params(VSTREAM *, int, int, char **);
198extern void pcf_edit_master_param(PCF_MASTER_ENT *, int, const char *, const char *);

200#define PCF_WARN_ON_OPEN_ERROR 0
201#define PCF_FAIL_ON_OPEN_ERROR 1
202
203#define PCF_MASTER_BLANKS " \t\r\n" /* XXX */
204
205 /*
206 * Master.cf parameter namespace management. The idea is to manage master.cf
207 * "-o name=value" settings with other tools than text editors.
208 *
209 * The natural choice is to use "service-name.service-type.parameter-name", but
210 * unfortunately the '.' may appear in service and parameter names.
211 *
212 * For example, a spawn(8) listener can have a service name 127.0.0.1:10028.
213 * This service name becomes part of a service-dependent parameter name
214 * "127.0.0.1:10028_time_limit". All those '.' characters mean we can't use
215 * '.' as the parameter namespace delimiter.
216 *
217 * (We could require that such service names are specified as $foo:port with
218 * the value of "foo" defined in main.cf or at the top of master.cf.)
219 *
220 * But it is easier if we use '/' instead.
221 */
222#define PCF_NAMESP_SEP_CH '/'
223#define PCF_NAMESP_SEP_STR "/"
224
225#define PCF_LEGACY_SEP_CH '.'
226
227 /*
228 * postconf_match.c.
229 */
230#define PCF_MATCH_WILDC_STR "*"
231#define PCF_MATCH_ANY(p) ((p)[0] == PCF_MATCH_WILDC_STR[0] && (p)[1] == 0)
232#define PCF_MATCH_STRING(p, s) (PCF_MATCH_ANY(p) || strcmp((p), (s)) == 0)
233
234extern ARGV *pcf_parse_service_pattern(const char *, int, int);
235extern int pcf_parse_field_pattern(const char *);
236
237#define PCF_IS_MAGIC_SERVICE_PATTERN(pat) \
238 (PCF_MATCH_ANY((pat)->argv[0]) || PCF_MATCH_ANY((pat)->argv[1]))
239#define PCF_MATCH_SERVICE_PATTERN(pat, name, type) \
240 (PCF_MATCH_STRING((pat)->argv[0], (name)) \
241 && PCF_MATCH_STRING((pat)->argv[1], (type)))
242
243#define pcf_is_magic_field_pattern(pat) ((pat) == PCF_MASTER_FLD_WILDC)
244#define pcf_str_field_pattern(pat) ((const char *) (pcf_field_name_offset[pat].name))
245
246#define PCF_IS_MAGIC_PARAM_PATTERN(pat) PCF_MATCH_ANY(pat)
247#define PCF_MATCH_PARAM_PATTERN(pat, name) PCF_MATCH_STRING((pat), (name))
248
249/* The following is not part of the postconf_match API. */
250extern NAME_CODE pcf_field_name_offset[];
251

253 * postconf_builtin.c.
254 */
255extern void pcf_register_builtin_parameters(const char *, pid_t);
256

258 * postconf_service.c.
259 */
260extern void pcf_register_service_parameters(void);

262 /*
263 * Parameter context structure.
264 */
265typedef struct {
266 PCF_MASTER_ENT *local_scope;
267 int param_class;
268} PCF_PARAM_CTX;
